definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Tom's friend said he was a double-tongued liar.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的朋友说他是个两面三刀的骗子。

sentences.english: He thinks most people are " Phonies ", especially adults4.
sentences.chinese: 他认为绝大多数人都是骗子，尤其是大人。

sentences.english: So how do you become a good liar?
sentences.chinese: 那么，怎样才能成为一个好骗子呢？

sentences.english: We are arrant knaves all; believe none of us.
sentences.chinese: 本人们都是彻头彻尾的年夜骗子，别信本人们。

sentences.english: I always hate phony people like that.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都很讨厌像他那样的骗子。

sentences.english: To their surprise, the so-called investor is a swindler.
sentences.chinese: 令他们吃惊的是，那个所谓的投资商是骗子。

sentences.english: Cherry blossoms dont know, good for the chance to cheat the daughter said Mr Weng good a liar.
sentences.chinese: 樱花不认识帕良，翁因趁机骗女儿说帕良是骗子。

sentences.english: He is just a dishonest trickster.
sentences.chinese: 床破只是一个不诚实的骗子。

sentences.english: The nation was led astray by a mountebank.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家被一个夸夸其谈的骗子引入歧途。

sentences.english: I told all the Israelites to kill the prophets of Baal because they were frauds.
sentences.chinese: 我让人们把那几个太阳神的骗子杀了。
测试武器补充，谢帕兹骗子。

sentences.english: Well, that doesn't tell me why you wanna be a grifter.
sentences.chinese: 你可这也没说明为什么你想当骗子。

sentences.english: I do my best to never, ever look like a crook.
sentences.chinese: 我尽一切所能让你根本看不出我是个骗子。

sentences.english: You’re like a fake, ’’ she said, “faking being well.
sentences.chinese: “你就像一个骗子，”她说，“假装自己很好。

sentences.english: The group of swindlers provided false information to entrap customers.
sentences.chinese: 这伙骗子提供假信息坑害顾客。

definition: a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to trick sb into having sex
to take sth to be true
